reviews.text: Allergic reaction on my neck after eating from this etaishment I don't feel like the food is clean and also the creamy pasta was dry with no cream I like to give places a chance sometimes but I'm going to stick with my own cooking or places I know for fact won't hurt me and cause this ordered under kiyon via uber .As I said I love to support small gems but I am left seeing why I can't trust it and should only make it on my own .will not be ordering again good luck
He doesn't take good care of customers

I had the Arnold palmer and chicken avocado salad with crispy chicken, very delicious. Even on a Tuesday night at 7pm, Rubyâ€™s was busy with people but the turn around service was very good. The staff were very friendly and the food was delicious.
Really good breakfast!

Il y en a plusieurs en ville. Bien que moins copieux que dâ€™autres restos, servent des PÃ¢tes trÃ¨s bonnes, en revanche service trÃ¨s moyen, lieu trÃ¨s bruyant. Mieux vaut rÃ©server avant de venir il y a toujours du monde le soir
Favorite brunch place ever. Come here consistently and get consistently good service and food!!!
Great service and excellent food.
$20 for cabbage and arugula

Comida deliciosa, lugar acogedor.
Buen servicio, y rÃ¡pido
Burger and fries was great.

The pasta spicy vodka had no taste and was not spicy at all.
The fried chicken used to be much better.
My friend ordered a Bronte and specifically asked for medium, but the meat was served well-done.

We are disappointed, as we are loyal customers and are used to much tastier food.
Got the spicy vodka and the creamy chicken with breaded chicken instead and it was delicious! Definitely would go back

Burger is very basic. Fries tastes weird and kinda crunchy. Min tip is 20%
Idk. Just isnâ€™t worth it
Small but the food was great is pretty busy at lunch.
Staff was very Attentive and breakfast was well worth the wait!
lovely family style, food and service and amto great too
I love soho location more than this one

Made reservations for a wednesday morning, we were the first ones there eheh. I was quite happy that it wasn't busy yet. The amount of tables in the small space of this cafe was eh, yea pretty large.

They had some nice coffee (with pretty are which never fails to make me happy). The passion fruit yogurt bowl was also really good. It was on the sweet side, but I mean look at it, it looks absolutely stunning, so who am I to complain about a little sugar.

Nice cafe, good food, the vibe's vibing.

The design shows someone put real thought into the space. Team members make dining here a joyful experience. This restaurant is ideal for social meetups and feels relaxed. The entr?e demonstrated perfect timing and technique. Experience it firsthand - you'll see what I mean.
Great local spot in Murray Hill for a casual bite to eat.
good
Good pasta (creamy chicken was great, rubys ragu was good), although portions could do with being a little bigger.  Good service.  Could have a long wait for inside table.
Food and drinks were pretty good.
Awful airport food with awful service.

Came here for breakfast! I had the big breakfast, the banana bread and an iced chai. I enjoyed all the flavors of the big breakfast minus the hash brown, it was giving a strange oil taste. Wasnâ€™t a big fan! I really enjoyed the flavor of the beans and the mushrooms- probably my favorite part. The sourdough was spongey and delicious, I ordered a side of butter to go with it and boy was it delicious! The banana bread was to die for, at first the butter had a strange fruity taste, but after a couple of bites I actually started to like it! The banana bread is so moist and flavorful, I like that they toast it before serving. I wasnâ€™t crazy about the chai- a little too watered down for my taste. For not being a lot of people the service was on the slower side. They also seemed to be changing shifts.
The food is amazing. Our server Jonah is the absolute best. He made sure that we were  ok. And he was so nice. Def going here again this week!
Delicious and drinks were nice with a great attention to detail.

This review is for the Sweet Corn Fritters, because I canâ€™t seem to order anything else whenever Iâ€™m at a Rubyâ€™s. I keep thinking Iâ€™ll branch out one day, but until then, hereâ€™s my take. The Murray Hill spot does a great job making the most of its cozy layout, though if you come during brunch rush, you might feel like youâ€™re part of the table next to you.
Food tastes great

The food looked fantastic, but I didnâ€™t end up eating because I saw a server touch dirty dishes and pick things off the floor without washing her hands and the bathroom was deplorable. I left after a cup of coffee.

Nice brunch experience here.  My son and I walked past and there was a wait for a table.  It looked like a hip, cool place so we added our name to the list.  It was a quick wait and the hostess texted us when the table was ready.  Food was delish!  Nice menu with an assortment of breakfast, sandwiches and bowls.

The food was delicious, the only problem is that waitress did not payed attention to our table on the outside, and also we had to order additional items with stuff inside, please note that this is what makes my night and the others ruined, even though food was good

I spent a week in NYC, and this was my favorite breakfast by far. I enjoyed the green breakfast bowl with a side of spicy pork sausage. I also enjoyed the [no adjective] breakfast bowl, which had perfectly poached eggs, half an avocado, peas, edamame, ricotta, prosciuttoâ€¦delicious!
Great spot for a well prepared lunch . Feels like home meal in the middle of the concrete jungle

they forgot to put in our food order TWICE and blamed it on the wifi ğŸ˜’ food was alright but service was downright terrible   And paid full price - no offers were made or anything to alleviate our dissatisfaction. When we ordered again they said it would take 20 minutes but new customers who had gotten there in the past ten minutes got their food first.  Extremely disappointed.

I love Rubyâ€™s so much! But I would really appreciate it if you could change the delivery packaging for pastas. I understand weâ€™re trying to be eco-friendly, but using a paper box for pasta doesnâ€™t work very well. It soaks up the sauce, and by the end, the paper starts falling apart.
Again, I really love Rubyâ€™s! This feedback is just regarding delivery. Thank you!
Pretty tight and crowded, but decent spot for a dinner. Food was yummy and service was alright
We really loved our dinner at Little Ruby's! Food was excellent (especially the fried chicken burger), staff were friendly and service was great. Highly recommend!
It is too hot to sit outside. But the food is great!
Great place for Breakfast or Lunch, great quality food, coffee is excellent and ate here a couple of times over a 2 day visit with friends
Warm and welcoming from the first greeting.
This place has it all. Prompt service, yummy food, nice atmosphere.
Everything from drinks to dessert was excellent.
Sitio muy bueno para tomar burgers, el servicio  esta genial
This place was absolutely fantastic. The food was amazing, the service was quick. There's not one thing I would change.
The portions were more than generous.

Visited around 2 PM on a Friday and waited about 10 minutes for an outdoor table. I ordered the pineapple mint juice, which was refreshing, and the fried chicken burger with fries, plus a side of bacon jam. The fries were crispy, medium-thick, and paired well with the truffle aioli. The chicken burger was tasty, but a bit messy; there was a little too much coleslaw.

My mom had the Ricotta Hotcakes, and I tried a bite. They were soft, fluffy, and perfectly sweet. Served with bananas, cream, and syrup, they were a standout! I don't know if this place is anything to write home about, but it's good.
Amazing food for all meals/times of the day! They have great pasta for dinner and even better brunch! They also have a great banana bread with passion fruit butter that is unique!

Some food here is really wonderful (ricotta pancakes!).
Lemonades are just terrible and taste so cheap.
Stuff does not really care about you, and  you are satisfied with order or not.â€¦

My wife and I love Little Ruby's and we always visit when we are in the city. We usually go to the SOHO location but we tried the Murray Hill location.

The food and the service were equally excellent. I would definitely recommend making a reservation before coming.

Overall, a fantastic little place for a brunch.
Very quick service, and friendly, too. The bowls were tasty, and very light. They felt a bit too light for the price. Nice fresh ambiance, I loved the outdoor seating.

This review is specifically for the Big Breakfast because I eat it at every Ruby's location! I keep telling myself that I should diversify and provide a more accurate review, so I will update my review if I ever end up not being a creature of habit. I think the Murray Hill location makes fantastic use of the small space they have! However, if you come at a busy time, you will be able to hear your neighbors' conversations because the tables are very close together.

The Big Breakfast ($20) comes with two eggs, bacon, mushrooms, roasted tomatoes, baked beans, hash brown, and sourdough toast. Everything is flavored very well, especially the mushrooms and the beans. The hash brown has been perfectly fried every time I have it, though it needs ketchup. For the tomatoes, I prefer them without the stems, and have had mixed experiences with that execution. The last time I went here, the toast was also over-toasted and seemed to not have butter on it, so it was very dry. I just think this is such a filling, tasty, and balanced meal!

Service at this location has always been welcoming! I have had people check in on me each time. They give you water, so they don't need to worry about water refills.
